scenarioDescription:
The HD 75784 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 75784 is a star with 1.26 times the mass of the Sun, and 3.4 times its radius. It is located 278.64 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 75784 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 75784 system


HD 75784 b

HD 75784 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2015-01, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 75784 b is 318.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 75784 b is 13.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 75784 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 75784 c

HD 75784 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2018-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 8.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 75784 c is 1793.520 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 75784 c is 12.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 75784 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 75784, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 75784 - System With 2 Exolanets
